    ok. Thanks a lot @cpeterso So using fake Chrome UA `Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2227.1 Safari/537.36` on MacOS X 10.10.4 in Gecko browser (42.0a1 (2015-07-27)) I get a green square ![capture d ecran 2015-07-28 a 18 16 56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/505230/8927865/6ed44d08-3555-11e5-9ff4-6393057e3fc2.jpg) ``` html <div style="width: 1280px; height: 544px;" class="moviePanel "> <video style="width: 1280px; height: 544px;" bgcolor="black" preload="preload" autoplay="autoplay" x-webkit-airplay="allow" src="http://movietrailers.apple.com/movies/disney/gooddinosaur/thegooddinosaur-tlr2_a720p.m4v?width=1280&amp;height=544" type="video/mp4" class=" video" id="" height="544" width="1280"></video> <div style="width: 1280px; height: 544px;" class="controllerPanel"> … </div> </div> ```

  • cpeterso 2015-08-04 17:01:39+00:00 2015-08-04 17:01:39+00:00
    Note that Firefox 40 enabled OS X hardware acceleration for video and the Apple trailers can crash Firefox or even the OS. This is Firefox [bug 1187103](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1187103). The trailers play using fine using HTML5 on Windows or Firefox 39 on OS X.
  • miketaylr 2015-08-11 14:12:16+00:00 2015-08-11 14:12:16+00:00
    I tweeted to @jonathandavis -- perhaps he doesn't read GitHub notifications: https://twitter.com/miketaylr/status/631105717420716037
  • jonathandavis 2015-08-11 18:33:57+00:00 2015-08-11 18:33:57+00:00
    Filed Radar 22234592: trailers.apple.com serving QuickTime movies to Firefox
  • miketaylr 2015-08-11 18:48:57+00:00 2015-08-11 18:48:57+00:00
    Thanks Jonathan!
  • cpeterso 2015-08-12 08:19:10+00:00 2015-08-12 08:19:10+00:00
    Thanks, @jonathandavis! [Firefox bug 1187103](https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1187103) has been fixed in Firefox (Nightly) 42, so trailers.apple.com's MP4 videos no longer crash Firefox on OS X.
  • karlcow 2015-08-25 01:55:44+00:00 2015-08-25 01:55:44+00:00
    Confirmed that Firefox 42+ is now working with the code sent to Chrome browser User Agent. Currently Firefox is at version 40.0.2 So I guess in around 12 weeks it would be safer for Apple to move Firefox users to the Chrome code.

  • karlcow 2016-05-05 02:28:53+00:00 2016-05-05 02:28:53+00:00
    http://trailers.apple.com/trailers/global/v4/scripts/app/app.js ``` js else { //check for video errors if (app.videoError && app.isFirefox) { alert(app.langBank[app.videoError]); } else { ``` `isFirefox` is defined by: ``` js app.isFirefox = ua.match('Firefox'); if (app.isFirefox && ua.match(/Mac OS X 10[_\.](\d+)/i)){ var fireVer = parseInt(ua.match(/Mac OS X 10[_\.](\d+)/i)[1]); if (fireVer > 10) { app.videoError = 'ref-firefox-version-error'; // jqBody.prepend('<div class="page-warning" data-lang="ref-firefox-version-error"></div>'); } } ``` which in my case right now returns: `fireVer = 11` which is strange because it is more… about macosx. so for macosx version > 10.10 like 11, we get an error message. No idea why. I would love someone from Apple to explain. Also does that mean that Firefox on Windows gets a free ticket? Or do we hit an issue elsewhere?

  • karlcow 2016-05-05 02:45:50+00:00 2016-05-05 02:45:50+00:00
    to note that the original HTML (through HTTP) contains nothing. Everything is done through JavaScript ``` html <header id="header-wrapper" class="top-wrapper"></header> <div id="main-wrapper"></div> <footer id="globalfooter"> <!-- Footer goes here --> </footer> ```
  • karlcow 2016-05-05 02:48:21+00:00 2016-05-05 02:48:21+00:00
    Probably code is coming from http://trailers.apple.com/trailers/global/v4/scripts/libs/ac_quicktime.js ``` js // init both tags with the required and "special" attributes var objTag = '<object ' + _QTAddObjectAttr("classid") + _QTAddObjectAttr("width") + _QTAddObjectAttr("height") + _QTAddObjectAttr("codebase") + _QTAddObjectAttr("name") + _QTAddObjectAttr("id") + _QTAddObjectAttr("tabindex") + _QTAddObjectAttr("hspace") + _QTAddObjectAttr("vspace") + _QTAddObjectAttr("border") + _QTAddObjectAttr("align") + _QTAddObjectAttr("class") + _QTAddObjectAttr("title") + _QTAddObjectAttr("accesskey") + _QTAddObjectAttr("noexternaldata") + _QTAddObjectAttr("obj#style") + '>' + _QTAddObjectParam("src", generateXHTML); var embedTag = '<embed ' + _QTAddEmbedAttr("type") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("src") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("width") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("height") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("pluginspage") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("name") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("id") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("align") + _QTAddEmbedAttr("tabindex"); // delete the attributes/params we have already added _QTDeleteTagAttrs("type","src","width","height","pluginspage","classid","codebase","name","tabindex", "hspace","vspace","border","align","noexternaldata","class","title","accesskey","id","style"); // and finally, add all of the remaining attributes to the embed and object for ( var attrName in gTagAttrs ) { attrValue = gTagAttrs[attrName]; if ( null != attrValue ) { embedTag += _QTAddEmbedAttr(attrName); objTag += _QTAddObjectParam(attrName, generateXHTML); } } // end both tags, we're done return objTag + embedTag + '></em' + 'bed></ob' + 'ject' + '>'; } ```

    - Firefox mac 10.11 Go use Safari - Firefox windows object+embed to http://movietrailers.apple.com/movies/independent/monkeykingheroisback/monkeyking-tlr1_i320.m4v - Safari http://movietrailers.apple.com/movies/independent/monkeykingheroisback/monkeyking-tlr1_480p.mov - Chrome video+source to http://movietrailers.apple.com/movies/independent/monkeykingheroisback/monkeyking-tlr1_i320.m4v
  • hallvors 2016-05-05 14:50:49+00:00 2016-05-05 14:50:49+00:00
    ``` GET http://movietrailers.apple.com/movies/independent/welcometohappiness/welcomeothappiness-tlr1_i320.m4v 302 Redirect to http://trailers.apple.com/ ``` - since we're being an OBJECT (or EMBED) and not a VIDEO element Firefox obeys what the server tells it to and renders the home page when fetching the video URL.
  • miketaylr 2016-05-06 19:56:01+00:00 2016-05-06 19:56:01+00:00
